item.title: What It’s Like to Be the First Person Eliminated on ‘Survivor’
item.description: These are the contestants who train for months, only to be voted off in Episode 1. As the show’s 50th season begins, we ask about their head-spinning turns.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Abrams

item.title: After ‘Love Island,’ Rob Rausch Was Wary of ‘The Traitors’
item.description: The Alabamian who is now a seasoned veteran of reality TV talks about sports, strategy and overalls (“just a great piece of clothing”).
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

item.title: Epstein Effort to Finance a Dick Cavett Film Undone by Background Check
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein joined Mr. Cavett’s wife in an effort to create a PBS documentary on the talk-show legend. But then the producers did a background check on the financier.
item.dc:creator: Michaela Towfighi and Julia Jacobs
item.media:description: Dick Cavett had an illustrious career as a talk-show host known for his probing interviews. When a documentary about him was in the early stages, Jeffrey Epstein took an interest.

item.title: 5 Great Specials to Stream This Winter
item.description: Taylor Tomlinson, Kevin Nealon, Chris Spencer, Isabel Hagen and Jackie Kashian deliver very different but very funny hours to get you through the cold.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman

item.title: How ‘The Pitt’ Grosses You Out
item.description: The medical drama tests viewers with protruding bones, visible organs and buckets of blood. Here’s how makeup and effects artists created seven gory afflictions.
item.dc:creator: Esther Zuckerman

item.title: ‘DTF St. Louis’ Review: Sex, Death and Jamba Juice
item.description: Steven Conrad (“Patriot”) brings his oddball sensibility to the limited-crime-series genre for HBO.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik
item.media:description: Jason Bateman, left, and David Harbour play unsatisfied suburbanites in “DTF St. Louis.”

item.title: I Needed ‘Heated Rivalry’: Gay Romance Minus the Tragedy
item.description: After a lifetime of settling for shame, secrecy and death onscreen, I had my doubts about “Heated Rivalry.” Then it seduced me, too.
item.dc:creator: Wesley Morris

item.title: ‘Murder in Glitterball City’ and True Crime’s Obsession With Location
item.description: The two-part documentary on HBO is not just the story of a gruesome murder, but a portrait of the city, neighborhood and home where it happened.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam
item.category: A Dark Room in Glitter Ball City: Murder, Secrets, and Scandal in Old Louisville (Book)
item.media:description: The home in Louisville, Ky., where James Carroll was murdered, as seen in the HBO documentary “Murder in Glitterball City.”

item.title: ‘Survivor’ Is America
item.description: It’s our greatest game and our truest mirror. And in its tiki-torch-festooned way, it’s captured our society as an ever-changing collection of tribes.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik

item.title: Christina Applegate’s New Memoir Is Furious, Funny and Profane
item.description: Funny, furious and profane, “You With the Sad Eyes” finds the TV star facing childhood trauma and reflecting on the limits imposed by illness.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Egan
item.media:description: Though she has retired from acting, Christina Applegate (here in front of her home) appeared onstage at the Emmy Awards in 2024.

item.title: ‘Scream 7’s’ Matthew Lillard is a Fan Favorite. If Only Hollywood Understood.
item.description: After a period of joblessness when he had to sell his home and cars, the “Scream” actor’s career is booming — whether Quentin Tarantino likes it or not.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Spencer
item.media:credit: Adali Schell for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I am the best kept secret in Hollywood because the reality is, I go to conventions and my lines are crazy long,” Lillard said.

item.title: ‘Love Story’ Has Former Calvin Klein Employees Feeling Nostalgic for the ’90s
item.description: FX’s “Love Story” has former employees waxing nostalgic about calla lilies (always white), paper clips (always black) and desk lunches (generally discouraged).
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher
item.category: Love Story: John F. Kennedy Jr. & Carolyn Bessette (TV Program)

item.title: Chris Fleming Uses Dance to Make Us Laugh in His HBO Special
item.description: The kind of performer other stand-ups rave about, Chris Fleming turns to choreography to land jokes in his new HBO special.
item.dc:creator: Melena Ryzik and Vincent Tullo
item.category: Chris Fleming: Live at the Palace (TV Program)
item.media:credit: Vincent Tullo for The New York Times

item.title: TMZ Drives Celebrity News. Thank This L.A. Intersection.
item.description: The website known for breaking news about famous deaths and juicy scandals has a name with roots in old Hollywood.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens
item.media:description: The celebrity crime, courts and gossip site TMZ has delivered Los Angeles-centric scoops since 2005, when it was founded by Harvey Levin.

item.title: Late Night Lampoons Trump’s State of the Union Ratings
item.description: Stephen Colbert joked that the president “is really dragging down broadcast television” with lower ratings for Tuesday’s State of the Union than last year’s address.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 8 Recap: Unplugged
item.description: Without internet, the Pitt was even more chaotic than usual. This on a national holiday on which people blow up things for fun.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.media:description: Nurse Princess (Kristin Villanueva) had to cover for Dana as the charge nurse for a while. Then the internet went out.

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Is Showing Us the Complicated Reality of Psychosis
item.description: Subtle signs of mental distress often emerge before severe symptoms.
item.dc:creator: Christina Caron

item.title: ‘Grease 2,’ the Giddy, Raunchy Flop That Brought Us Michelle Pfeiffer
item.description: The highly anticipated 1982 sequel failed to meet expectations at the time but has since charmed an adoring following with its ambitious dance numbers and nonstop ear worms.
item.dc:creator: Maya Salam

item.title: Late Night Fixates on How Long Trump Spoke
item.description: “This time, Trump spoke and everyone else fell asleep,” Jimmy Fallon said.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: Lauren Chapin, Youngest Child on ‘Father Knows Best,’ Dies at 80
item.description: For six seasons, she was Kathy, a giggly tomboy whose father, played by Robert Young, called her Kitten. Her offscreen life, however, was harrowing.
item.dc:creator: Anita Gates

item.title: BBC and BAFTA Say They Are Investigating After Broadcast of Racist Slur
item.description: The awards organization and the broadcaster have ordered separate investigations into what led to airing the slur, which was shouted involuntarily during Sunday’s ceremony.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Kwai
item.category: British Academy of Film and Television
item.media:description: The actors Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were onstage at the BAFTA Awards when a racist slur was involuntarily shouted by a man with Tourette’s syndrome.

item.title: Podcasts? TV Talk Shows? Netflix Just Hopes They’re Hits.
item.description: The podcasts in the streamer’s debut crop, including “The Pete Davidson Show,” have revived metaphysical questions about the definition of the medium.
item.dc:creator: Reggie Ugwu
item.category: The White House With Michael Irvin (TV Program)

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Goes Live After a Super Long State of the Union
item.description: “I can’t believe America missed an all-new ‘Will Trent’ for this one,” he joked.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: ‘Heated Rivalry’ Author Says Parkinson’s Symptoms Are Worsening and Delays Book
item.description: Rachel Reid told fans that the disease’s progression was slowing her writing and that a much-anticipated follow-up book would be pushed back.
item.dc:creator: Remy Tumin
item.media:credit: Carolina Andrade for The New York Times
item.media:description: Reid published in 2018 the first novel in the series, “Game Changer,” about a closeted hockey player who fell in love with a barista.

item.title: Review: ‘You Got Older,’ With Alia Shawkat, Gets a Sharp Revival
item.description: Clare Barron’s gorgeous play, about an unmoored young woman returning home to care for her father, finds a new home at Cherry Lane Theater.
item.dc:creator: Helen Shaw
item.media:description: Alia Shawkat and Peter Friedman in Clare Barron’s “You Got Older” at the Cherry Lane Theater in Manhattan.

item.title: Late Night Sums Up Trump’s Tariff Tiff with the Supreme Court
item.description: “Wow, a court composed mostly of his own party’s appointees has struck down the constitutionality of Trump’s go-it-alone tariff regime,” Jon Stewart said. “That’s bound to cause him some introspection.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
Have I Got News for You (TV Program)
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: The Never-Ending Trial of Tyra Banks
item.description: A new docuseries has renewed criticism of the supermodel-turned-TV mogul. It’s just one cost of her barrier-breaking career.
item.dc:creator: Maya Phillips
item.category: Reality Check: Inside America's Next Top Model (TV Program)
item.media:description: Tyra Banks sitting for an interview in “Reality Check: Inside America’s Next Top Model.”

item.title: The ‘Scrubs’ Reboot, Plus 6 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The medical comedy is back for another run, and the 50th season of “Survivor” is set to begin.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez
item.media:description: Donald Faison, left, and Zach Braff in “Scrubs.”

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1 Finale Recap: On the Road Again
item.description: A melancholy finale sees Dunk finally treated as a proper knight, which includes a royal request to take on Egg as his proper squire.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)
item.media:description: Egg (Dexter Sol Ansell) still wants to stay with Dunk, but Dunk says he is “done with princes.”
